text.p: Spanish government bonds ended lower on Monday, but off lows, after a quiet holiday trading session spent watching European neighbours, dealers said.
"We've been tied to other European bonds -- basically the Italian Btp and the German Bund -- and our scope for autonomous movement is very limited," an analyst said.

Although the yield spread narrowed to a historic low of 59 basis points in early trade, it widened again to close at 61 bps. Dealers said the spread was unlikely to narrow much below 60 bps without new trading incentives.
The market is awaiting U.S. data later this week, as domestic incentives remain scarce.
"We don't have anything domestic coming up, at least, until we learn something more on the budget from the cabinet meeting this Friday," the analyst said.
